text: the stupidity of impeaching a citizen who is NO LONGER in office is so beyond.  What the F&@! is the point he no longer holds the office.  #walkaway #walkawaycampaign #commonsense

answers.text: @_dawnsea oh and if you’re doing hashtags, I will too!! #bitchbehumble #sitdownbehumble #youreprobablyaracist #gobacktopartycitywhereyoubelong #kindlygooglesomeshit #didQSendYouEw #youhavenocommonsense (it takes actual sense to have ‘common sense’ hence the common) #youprobablycouldntlistthefirst15presidents

@_dawnsea Rachel Maddow actually made a great analogy: if you were running laps in gym class and then the bell rings BUT your gym teacher keeps you there running laps AND THEN gives you detention for being late to class, you would be incensed. Because it’s absurd. The shenanigans pulled by the republicans were and are absurd. There is no place in the constitution that says you cannot not impeach a former government official. In fact, in the beginning, it was ex-gov officials who reckoned with impeachment. Kindly, come up in here with zero knowledge, zero history, and zero sense trying to argue that musty old defense. trumps lawyers tried it yesterday, and they looked foolish. A bipartisan vote proved that. Farewell!
